pli-tv-pvr19:26.2: Dukkaṭā katā would seem to be plural, but according to the sub-commentary, it should be read as singular. (): Dukkaṭā katāti dukkaṭaṃ vuttaṃ, “Dukkaṭā katā: an offense of wrong conduct is said.”
pli-tv-pvr19:45.4: According to the commentary, the instrumental adhikaraṇena should be read as an accusative. (): Pañcannaṃ adhikaraṇena cāti adhikaraṇañca pañcannamevāti attho.
pli-tv-pvr19:47.2: Again, it seems the instrumental, vūpasamena, should be read as an accusative. (): Pañcannaṃ vūpasamena cāti etesaṃyeva pañcannaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vinicchitaṃ vūpasantaṃ nāma hotīti attho.
pli-tv-pvr19:64.4: I have added days from the commentary for the statement to be meaningful. (): Dasa cīvaradhāraṇāti dasa divasāni atirekacīvarassa dhāraṇā anuññātāti attho, “Dasa cīvaradhāraṇā: the meaning is that ten days of keeping an extra robe is allowed.”
